title: [DISCUSS] [REEF-1477] Provide a data-centric API for stitching REEF jobs together
body:
**This should not be merged. This is for discussion purposes only.**

This is another discussion PR for [REEF-1477](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1477). The first discussion PR can be found [here](https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/1074).

This PR contains basic interfaces and rough implementations for the dataset API being discussed in [REEF-1477](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1477) and [REEF-1479](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1479).

The driver runs a 'stage' for each `RunStage()` call, which represents a single operation on a certain dataset. A StageDriver configuration must be provided by the user for each stage, telling REEF what to do with the evaluators that have been loaded with data (previously was MiniDriver, renamed following @zerg-junior's advice).

When creating a new dataset by loading remote data, the driver can (sort of) control where each partition will be assigned to, and thus creating an `IDataSet` object can be done by carefully handling `IAllocatedEvaluator` and `IActiveContext` events.

On the other hand, when creating a new dataset from another dataset (`RunStage()`), the story is a little different. The user-provided StageDriver can choose to generate partitions in whatever way the user wants, so simply checking the `IActiveContext` or `ICompletedTask` events is not enough. Instead, this PR introduces `PartitionCollector` (driver-side) and `PartitionReporter` (evaluator-side); the `PartitionReporter` uses the evaluator heartbeat channel to pass new partitions to the driver. For example, when a Transform stage is issued, a TransformTask is run on all evaluators, and for each old partition a new partition is generated and reported to the driver via the `PartitionReporter`-`PartitionCollector` route. The information gathered at the driver-side `PartitionCollector` is later used to form the new `IDataSet` object, which is in turn passed to the `RunStage()` caller.

For now, a few assumptions have been made such as ignoring the dataset id, for the sake of simplicity. Also, some missing content such as `TransformTask` or the whole `IDataSet.Collect()` mechanism is not included here, since it's already so long.

@markusweimer @shravanmn @dkm2110 Could you please kindly take a look?

title: [DISCUSS] [REEF-1477] Provide a data-centric API for stitching REEF jobs together
body:
**This should not be merged. This is for discussion purposes only.**

This PR contains basic interfaces for the dataset API being discussed in [REEF-1477](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1477) and [REEF-1479](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1479). The interface methods should give us an idea of how this API will be used, from the driver-side and the task-side.

On the driver-side, `DataSetInfo`, `PartitionInfo`, and `BlockInfo` are provided for managing partition/block locations. MiniDriver implementations can use this information to assign tasks to evaluators appropriately (for data locality). For cases where all tasks are treated equally, the MiniDriver can simply submit tasks to the given evaluators regardless of the `BlockInfo`s.

On the task-side, the task (or some underlying manager class) can access all partitions with partition ids. Fetching specific blocks is possible too, but in many cases a block is meaningful only when merged with preceding/following blocks, so the suggested way would be to fetch a partition, and then iterate through its blocks (`IEnumerable<Block>`).

I'd greatly appreciate comments on all parts; especially on the `MiniDriver` interface and the partition fetching part, whether they make sense or not. Please don't mind the project name (`Org.Apache.REEF.Demo`); that will be changed when we start putting in real PRs.

title: [REEF-650] Introduce example that actually uses IPerMapperConfigs in
body:
IMRU

This addressed the issue by
- Add new example NaturalSum that uses IPerMapperConfigs
- Add in-process test for NaturalSum
- Move few common classes to higher directory

JIRA:
  [REEF-650](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-650)

Pull Request:
  Closes #

Remarks:
  The new example in this PR was added to demonstrate the use of IPerMapperConfigs that was introduced in [REEF-638](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-638). N mappers are instantiated, each given a integer id (1, 2, 3, ... N). The map functions simply return the mapper's ids, and the ids get summed up via the reduce function and get passed to the updater. The job finishes after this single iteration.
`NaturalSumTest` runs this example, checking whether the returned sum equals n(n+1)/2 or not.

title: [REEF-1137] REEF Standalone Runtime
body:
This PR:
- Is based on REEF Runtime Local and YARN, and uses some of its classes for
  Standalone Runtime.
- Implements ssh connections and remote submission to make
  HelloREEFStandalone work, using the JSch library.
- Assumes that the user has the `authorized_keys` set up with `id_dsa` on the remote
  machine.
- Requires `node_list_file_path` parameter specifying the file containing
  the list of remote machines.
- Saves the results under the REEF_LOCAL_RUNTIME folder.
- Credits to Dongjin(@LastOne817) for starting off the job.

JIRA: [REEF-1137](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1137)
closes

title: [REEF-1251] IMRU Driver handlers for fault tolerant
body:
- IMRU Driver handler re-write to support fault tolerant
- ServiceAndContextConfigurationProvider refactor and clean up for the updated IMRU driver

- Minor changes in ActiveContextManager
- Test case will follow after REEF-1408 is merged.

title: [REEF-1388] Fix RunningTask to be sent for short-lived .NET tasks
body:
This change:
- sends RUNNING message immediately before Task.call(), instead of
  relying on time-based heartbeat to report task in Running state.
- removes Thread.Sleep() calls from tests which don't need them any more.
- fixes tests which rely on running status improperly.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1388](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1388)

Pull request:
  This closes #

title: [REEF-1412] Use a two-file approach for DFSEvaluatorLogOverwriteWriter
body:
This addressed the issue by
- Modifying DFSEvaluatorLogAppendWriter to DFSEvaluatorLogAppendReaderWriter such that it is aware of both read and write file paths.
- Adding helper DFSLineReader to assist in reading DFS files.
- Increasing number of Evaluator requests in HelloRestartDriver to test the functionality of writing longer files.

We had better upgrade ours to HDP 2.4.2.

title: [REEF-1392] Adding IObserver<ICloseEvent> for IMRU tasks
body:
- IMRU tasks implement IObserver<ICloseEvent>
- Task will return after it receives the close event and completes the current iteration
- Update TaskStateMachine to allow transit from TaskWaitingForClose with CompletedTask event to TaskClosedByDriver state
- Adding test cases
